content: A train travels between two cities with a total distance of 450 miles. The train takes 6 hours to complete the journey. What is its average speed?

So the train travels a total distance of 450 miles and it takes 6 hours to do that. I need to find out the average speed of the train. I remember that average speed is calculated by dividing the total distance traveled by the total time taken. So, in this case, it would be 450 miles divided by 6 hours. Let me do the math: 450 divided by 6 is 75. So, the average speed of the train is 75 miles per hour. I think that makes sense because if it travels 450 miles in 6 hours, moving at a consistent speed, it would be going at 75 miles each hour. But just to be sure, maybe I should consider if the train was moving at a constant speed or if it had stops along the way. The question doesn't mention any stops, so I'm assuming it's a non-stop journey at a constant speed. Also, average speed takes into account any variations in speed, like speeding up or slowing down, but since it's average, 75 miles per hour seems correct. Maybe I should double-check the formula to be absolutely sure. Yes, average speed is indeed total distance divided by total time. So, 450 miles / 6 hours = 75 miles per hour. I think that's the answer. [Final Answer] \boxed{75}
